item.title: Florida Supreme Court OK's Abortion Ballot Measure, Teeing Up Major Fight
item.description: The decision puts abortion front and center in the state in a presidential election year.

item.title: S&P 500 Drops to Start New Quarter
item.description: Fresh data raise doubts on whether the Fed will cut rates three times this year. The S&P 500 fell 0.2% and the Dow industrials shed 0.6% after both finished last week at records.

item.title: Person Tests Positive for Bird Flu in Texas After Exposure to Cattle
item.description: It is the second known human case of H5N1 infection in the U.S.

item.title: Russian Court Extends Detention of Radio Free Europe Reporter
item.description: Alsu Kurmasheva, who holds both U.S. and Russian citizenship, is to be held until June 5, a judge ruled, as relations between Moscow and Washington plummet.

item.title: Trump Media Shares Tumble After Recent Cash Crunch Disclosed
item.description: The stock’s plunge erased more than $1 billion from Donald Trump’s approximately 57% stake in the company.

item.title: If You Think Most Voters Distrust the Media…
item.description: … imagine what the staff of Air Force One thinks of the press.

item.title: Postal Service Picks UPS to Move Air Cargo, Replacing FedEx
item.description: The FedEx contract is set to end in September after more than 20 years.

item.title: 'Cowboy Carter' Review:Beyoncé'sRide at the Rodeo
item.description: The superstar singer leans into country music on an ambitious if uneven new album that knocks down the fences between genres with indomitable confidence.

item.title: SPDR Gold Up 0.7% as Commodity Hits New Record
item.description: Gold prices reached a record high as traders appear to be embracing the recent run-up in prices.

item.title: Chilean Telecommunications Provider WOM Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy
item.description: Chilean telecommunications provider WOM filed for bankruptcy, blaming a delayed 5G network rollout, aggressive vendor actions and credit downgrades that spooked a lender.

item.title: Israel Blamed for Attack Killing Iranian General in Damascus
item.description: Iran accused Israel of a deadly missile strike on an Iranian diplomatic building in Damascus, in a possible escalation of the shadow war between the two countries.

item.title: It's Time to Hand Cybersecurity Over to the Computers
item.description: A healthcare-industry hack shows the need for autonomous databases and operating systems.

item.title: Notable & Quotable: Comedy
item.description: ‘All three of you have been on Air Force One. . . . That’s made by Boeing, right? . . . Do those doors stay on?’

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Boosted by Short-Covering
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures settled higher as near-term weather forecasts suggested some late-season demand could help chip away at storage surpluses.

item.title: All Wound Up (Tuesday Crossword, April 2)
Beyoncé's Country Album Isn't Meant for Nashville
item.description: With “Cowboy Carter,” the pop superstar reimagines the genre—and creates her own country-radio station.

item.title: Israel's Campaign at Gaza's Al-Shifa Hospital Reveals Gaps in Effort to Subdue Hamas
item.description: The renewed fighting at a hospital first cleared in November ended with much of the hospital destroyed, patients traumatized, and thousands of others forced to leave or detained.

item.title: Is the Erdogan Era Ending in Turkey?
item.description: Voters hand the opposition a landslide victory in local elections.

item.title: New Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Filings -- Week Ending March 31, 2024
item.description: A list of some new chapter 11 bankruptcy filings made during the last week.

item.title: Steve Wynn and Thomas Peterffy Are About to Hand Aspen Its First $100 Million Home Sale
item.description: The pair are in contract to pay $110 million for Patrick Dovigi’s mansion, which he bought for $72.5 million in 2021.
